measured_by: 1–5 Likert scale hospital-choice item contrasting human doctor vs AI algorithm
justification: “Participants answered the question on a 1 ("Definitely the hospital where the human doctor makes triage decisions") to 5 ("Definitely the hospital where an AI-based algorithm makes triage decisions") scale.”

measured_by: Binary forced-choice of hospital with human triage vs algorithm triage
justification: “In Study 4 we used a binary choice measure, asking participants to choose one of the two hospitals, mirroring real-life decisions.”
“Participants first completed the MacArthur subjective SES scale (Adler et al., 2000), which is an established measure of SES widely used in social psychology.”

measured_by: Three-item scale modified from the Moral Foundations Questionnaire
justification: “Participants answered three items measuring how they perceive the authority of doctors, modified from the Moral Foundations Questionnaire (Graham et al., 2011) on a 1 (Strongly disagree) to 5 (Strongly agree) scale.”
“As specified in the pre-registration, we measured trust in physicians (Thom et al., 1999) as another possible mediator.”
